cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles south of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest, then turning north-northwest and skirting the southeast Florida coast toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the southeast Florida coast between Boca Raton and Port St. Lucie

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to south of Boca Raton, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton, FL (tropical-storm) ; Boca Raton to Volusia/Flagler County line, FL (hurricane)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coastline from Miami-Dade through Palm Beach counties
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out Saturday night and Sunday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible near Port Everglades with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: General 2–4 inches with isolated spots up to 6 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents impacting vessel traffic and berth operations.
